data:
Generate a story and a one short sentence as a title in the journalism style. For the story you generate put the title at the first row. The story should involves the following entities and summary. Please make sure the story you generate is at least 500 words long.
Summary: Previously owned by Kanye West and shuttered years ago, the long-running LA-based chain known for serving burgers in several sizes has reopened at 15110 S. La Grange Rd., under a partnership between NBA stars Anthony Davis Jr., Derrick Rose, and Tim Hardaway Jr. The burger spot also includes a taste of Fatburger's sister wing brand, Buffalo’s Express. The partnership was spearheaded by Black female entrepreneurs and Chicago businesswomen Toi Salter and Jackie Jackson. In addition to Salter's and Jackson's work in the area, families of all three players have ties to Chicago, according to a release. “Our team is excited to bring the iconic brand Fatburger back to the state of Illinois,” said Salter, Managing Partner of A.D.T.J. “This opening is just the start of our growth in the state, and it is particularly meaningful to have on-board such an experienced partner to lead our expansion, including such celebrated athletes as Anthony, Derrick and Tim.” A complement to Fatburger, Buffalo’s Express menu includes bone-in and boneless chicken wings accompanied by a range of original sauces. All of Buffalo’s Express’ wings are accompanied by celery, carrots, and blue cheese, ranch or honey mustard dressing.Brands Inc. announces the opening of Fatburger and Buffalo’s Express in Orland Park, IL with franchisee A.D.T.J. Development LLC, a company created in partnership with professional basketball players, Anthony Davis Jr., Derrick Rose and Tim Hardaway Jr., and Chicago businesswomen, Toi Salter and Jackie Jackson, will also be bringing additional franchised locations of Fatburger and Buffalo’s Express to Illinois in the coming years. “Our team is excited to bring Fatburger back to the state of Illinois,” said Toi Salter, Managing Partner of A.D.T.J. Ever since the first Fatburger opened in Los Angeles 70 years ago, the chain has been known for its delicious, grilled-to-perfection and cooked to order burgers. In addition to its famous burgers, the Fatburger menu also includes Fat and Skinny Fries, sweet potato fries, scratch-made onion rings, turkeyburgers, hand-breaded crispy chicken sandwiches, and hand-scooped milkshakes made from 100% real ice cream. A perfect complement to Fatburger, Buffalo’s Express menu includes delicious bone-in and boneless chicken wings accompanied by a range of original sauces. All of Buffalo’s Express’ wings are accompanied by celery, carrots, and blue cheese, ranch or honey mustard dressing. A grand opening celebration will be held Monday, March 13 where the first 100 customers will receive a free Original Fatburger.FAT Brands Ever since the first Fatburger opened in Los Angeles 70 years ago, the chain has been known for its delicious, grilled-to-perfection and cooked to order burgers. FAT Brands Inc. announced the opening of Fatburger and Buffalo’s Express in Orland Park, Illinois, with franchisee A.D.T.J. Development LLC, a company created in partnership with professional basketball players, Anthony Davis Jr., Derrick Rose and Tim Hardaway Jr., and Chicago businesswomen, Toi Salter and Jackie Jackson, will also be bringing additional franchised locations of Fatburger and Buffalo’s Express to Illinois in the coming years. “Our team is excited to bring the iconic brand Fatburger back to the state of Illinois,” says Toi Salter, Managing Partner of A.D.T.J. “This opening is the just the start of our growth in the state, and it is particularly meaningful to have on-board such an experienced partner to lead our expansion, including such celebrated athletes as Anthony, Derrick and Tim.” Ever since the first Fatburger opened in Los Angeles 70 years ago, the chain has been known for its delicious, grilled-to-perfection and cooked to order burgers. A perfect complement to Fatburger, Buffalo’s Express menu includes delicious bone-in and boneless chicken wings accompanied by a range of original sauces. All of Buffalo’s Express’ wings are accompanied by celery, carrots, and blue cheese, ranch or honey mustard dressing. A grand opening celebration will be held Monday, March 13 where the first 100 customers will receive a free Original Fatburger.

Begin story:

FAT Brands Brings Famous Fatburger and Buffalo’s Express to Illinois in Partnership with NBA Stars and Chicago Businesswomen, Toi Salter and Jackie Jackson

Orland Park, IL - Fatburger and Buffalo’s Express have officially opened their doors in Orland Park, Illinois, thanks to a partnership between professional basketball players, Anthony Davis Jr., Derrick Rose and Tim Hardaway Jr., and Chicago businesswomen, Toi Salter and Jackie Jackson. The decision to open the chain’s first restaurant in Illinois was a deliberate one, as all three players have ties to the Chicago community.

“Toi and I both have deep roots in Chicago, and it’s an honor to be able to bring such a beloved chain like Fatburger back to the state and to be able to give back to the community that has given us so much,” said Jackie Jackson.

Fatburger has long been known for its delicious, grilled-to-perfection and cooked to order burgers, and the menu at the Orland Park location certainly lives up to that reputation. From the classic Fatburger to turkey burgers, Fat and Skinny Fries, and scratch-made onion rings, there’s something to satisfy every appetite.

The restaurant’s sister wing brand, Buffalo’s Express, is also making its debut at the Orland Park location. The menu includes bone-in and boneless chicken wings accompanied by a range of original sauces. All of Buffalo’s Express’ wings come with celery, carrots, and blue cheese, ranch or honey mustard dressing.

“Our team is excited to bring the iconic brand Fatburger back to the state of Illinois,” said Toi Salter, Managing Partner of A.D.T.J. Development LLC. “This opening is just the start of our growth in the state, and it is particularly meaningful to have on-board such an experienced partner to lead our expansion, including such celebrated athletes as Anthony, Derrick and Tim.”

The partnership between Salter, Jackson, and the NBA stars was not just a business arrangement; it was an opportunity to create an impact in the community. Salter and Jackson are both Black female entrepreneurs who have made it their mission to invest in their community, and they saw this partnership as a way to continue that work.

“We’re not just opening a restaurant; we’re building bridges between the community and successful Black entrepreneurs,” said Jackson. “We want to inspire the kids in our community to see us and know that they can do anything they set their minds to.”

The grand opening celebration on March 13 was a testament to the impact that this partnership could have on the community. The first 100 customers received a free Original Fatburger, and the restaurant was packed with locals eager to try the new dining options.

Fatburger and Buffalo’s Express have been a staple in Los Angeles for over 70 years, and now they’re making their mark on Illinois. The partnership between A.D.T.J. Development LLC and FAT Brands’ Fast Casual Division brings the two popular chains to the state with plans for additional locations in the pipeline.

“We are thrilled to be working with Toi, Jackie, and the NBA stars on this exciting venture,” said COO of FAT Brands, Jake Berchtold. “Their passion for the community and commitment to excellence perfectly aligns with the FAT Brands’ mission, and we can’t wait to see what the future holds.”

For fans of the famous burger joint and wing chain, the wait is over. Fatburger and Buffalo’s Express are open for business in Illinois, and they’re ready to serve up some tasty treats.
